content.description:
Slabby.  Climb the nice slab adjacent to the end of the Crackhead log.

Lip-Smack area.  Same boulder as Crackhead.
boulder pad(s)

Start as low as you can in the crack, work your way up with toe hooks and underclings, do a big move to gain the right side of the arete and muscle your way up and over.


Up the path from Octagon, look for the obvious horizontal log stuck in a crack.
Be careful where you put your pads. Use at least two and make sure a spotter watches the rock a foot off the ground on the climbers left. A fall in the crack at the wrong place can lead to a dangerous knock to the back of the head on that bad boy.

Hulkster's Humpfest and WWF Action Start standing matched on a good sloping rail. Move up past another good hold to the lip. The unique moves over the lip are what give this problem its name. Take the trail that leads into the forest by the Superfly boulder. Follow this trail for a short distance to a fork. The naked statue is by this fork. Going right leads to Bobo Jones, Cheese Grater, the Black Dyke boulder, and more. Going left leads up towards the Grand Wall. Take this left fork.

After a very short distance you will pass the obvious Crackhead boulder on your right and off the trail, with a large tree sticking out of it. Hulkster's Humpfest is on the backside of the Crackhead boulder, around the right, and is not visible from the main trail. The landing is quite flat though there is a rock that requires some careful padding.

Start matched on the right side of the boulder on a good incut edge. Traverse the rail left and up to the lip using some combination of heel hooks and/or horrifically bad feet. The first time I tried this it felt ridiculously hard for V2, and then I tried the heel hook. Aha. A nice problem and deserving of its Top 100 status. I recommend purchasing Marc Bourdon's excellent guidebook from one of the local stores, but even with that I thought it was rather tricky to find.

Take the trail that leads into the forest by the Superfly boulder. Follow this trail for a short distance to a fork. The naked statue is by this fork. Going right leads to Bobo Jones, Cheese Grater, the Black Dyke boulder, and more. Going left leads up towards the Grand Wall. Take this left fork for Paperboy.

After a very short distance you will pass the obvious Crackhead boulder on your right and off the trail, with a large tree sticking out of it. Paperboy is a short distance beyond this, also on the right, and is not visible from the trail. A nice flat landing and a fairly low top out makes Paperboy quite safe with just a single pad and no spotter.

Hulkster's Humpfest and WWF Action       
  
 Start matched on a rail with bad feet, trying not to fall in the hole. Move up to a sloping shelf, and an easy top out.

Take the Grand Wall trail as per the Lip-Smack area description. Just past the Superfly area there is a fork. The nude statue is to your right, and the Grand Wall base straight ahead. Take the Grand Wall trail and after a very short distance past the fork you will pass the obvious Crackhead boulder on your right and off the trail, with a large tree sticking out of it. WWF Action is on the backside of the Crackhead boulder, around the right, and is not visible from the main trail.
The landing is quite flat though there is a rock that requires some careful padding.

This area encompasses the problems immediately east of the Octagon area. To access follow the second Psych Ledge trail (see Grand Wall page) past the BC Parks sign. Pass the Superfly boulder on your left. At an intersection the nude statue is to your right. Stay straight (this is the trail to the Grand Wall base). 
  
 The Lip-Smack area is to the south of the trail, just past the intersection.
